title: Leptogenesis with Majoron Dark Matter
authors: Stephen F. King, Soumen Kumar Manna, Rishav Roshan and Arunansu Sil
abstract:
We discuss a model of neutrino mass based on the type I seesaw mechanism
embedded in a spontaneously broken global lepton number framework with a $Z_2$
symmetry. We show that the resulting Majoron is a viable freeze-in dark matter
candidate. Two right-handed neutrinos are assumed to have dominant off-diagonal
masses suggesting resonant leptogenesis as the origin of baryon asymmetry of
the Universe. Explicit higher dimensional lepton number violating operators,
are shown to play a crucial role in simultaneously controlling both the Majoron
production in the early Universe and the right handed neutrino mass splitting
relevant for resonant leptogenesis. We perform a combined analysis of Majoron
dark matter and leptogenesis, discussing the relative importance of self energy
and vertex contributions to CP asymmetry, and explore the parameter space,
leading to an intricate relation between neutrino mass, dark matter and baryon
asymmetry.
